romeo_and_juliet.title: Romeo and Juliet
romeo_and_juliet.author: William Shakespeare
romeo_and_juliet.central_conflict: Two young lovers from feuding families must navigate their forbidden relationship

key_characters.name: Romeo
key_characters.arc: transforms from lovesick youth to someone willing to die for love

key_characters.name: Juliet
key_characters.arc: grows from obedient daughter to defiant lover

plot_beats: Establish the feud between two powerful groups
Protagonists meet and feel instant connection
Secret relationship develops despite obstacles
External conflict forces a crisis point
Misunderstanding leads to tragic decision
Death of lovers reconciles the feuding parties
romeo_and_juliet.emotional_core: Love powerful enough to transcend hatred, but destroyed by the very conflict it tried to overcome

hamlet.title: Hamlet
hamlet.author: William Shakespeare
hamlet.central_conflict: A prince must decide whether to avenge his father's murder by his uncle

key_characters.name: Claudius
key_characters.arc: power gained through murder leads to paranoia

key_characters.name: Ophelia
key_characters.arc: caught between loyalties, driven to madness

plot_beats: Revelation of hidden crime by supernatural means
Protagonist struggles with burden of knowledge
Attempts to confirm the truth
Collateral damage from investigation
Final confrontation exposes all secrets
Protagonist achieves goal but at ultimate cost
hamlet.emotional_core: The paralysis of overthinking and the corruption that spreads when justice is delayed

odyssey.title: The Odyssey
odyssey.author: Homer
odyssey.central_conflict: A hero struggles to return home after war while facing supernatural obstacles
plot_beats: Hero separated from home by circumstances
Series of trials test character and resolve
Temptations to abandon the journey
Lowest point where all seems lost
Return in disguise to assess situation
Reclaiming of home and identity
odyssey.emotional_core: The longing for home and the price of the journey that shapes who we become

dracula.title: Dracula
dracula.author: Bram Stoker
dracula.central_conflict: An ancient vampire infiltrates modern society, and a group must stop him

key_characters.name: Dracula
key_characters.arc: brings old-world evil to new world

key_characters.name: Van Helsing
key_characters.arc: bridges old knowledge and new methods

plot_beats: Outsider encounters evil in its domain
Evil infiltrates protagonist's world
Loved one becomes victim
Group assembles with diverse skills
Hunt and confrontation
Destruction of evil at great cost
dracula.emotional_core: Fear of corruption from within and the power of unity against darkness
